definition: to look after/to take care of/to attend to
according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

sentences.english: We shouldn't wait for relatives to come to our door before we take care of them.
sentences.chinese: 若論親戚之間，原該不等上門來就該有照應纔是。

sentences.english: Our days should be as carefully tended.
sentences.chinese: 我們的日子也應如此須得到細心照應。

sentences.english: This paper introduces the pragmatic approaches to bridging assumptions, the Result and Reason interpretations of bridging.
sentences.chinese: 本文介紹了語用照應的推想方法和語用照應因果論。

sentences.english: This paper introduces the pragmatic approaches to bridging assumptions, the Result and Reason interpretations of bridging.
sentences.chinese: 本文介紹了語用照應的推想方法和語用照應因果論。

sentences.english: Aunt Isabella had not you and me to nurse her,' I replied.
sentences.chinese: “伊莎貝拉姑姑沒有你和我來照應她，”我回答。

sentences.english: This dissertation reports on a systematic study of anaphoric repair in Chinese conversation.
sentences.chinese: 本文對漢語會話中的照應修正現象進行了系統研究。

sentences.english: Mrs. Wang did forme during my illness.
sentences.chinese: 我生病時王太太照應我。

sentences.english: My friends and I manned the booth at the fair.
sentences.chinese: 我和朋友在照應展銷會上的這個攤點。

sentences.english: This process can be reflected in the Anaphor Repair Model promoted in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 這一過程在本文提出的照應語修正模型中得以體現。

sentences.english: Neptune is your modern day ruling planet whose job it is to take very good care of you.
sentences.chinese: 海王星是當今照應你的主星，會給予你很好的照料。

sentences.english: They have three dogs to look after, not to mention the cat and the bird.
sentences.chinese: 他們有三隻狗要照應，更別提那隻貓和鳥了。

sentences.english: Everyone's immolationless care and attention makes her life full of sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 大家的無私照應煳關心使她的生活充滿了陽光。

sentences.english: The referents of anaphora mentally exist.
sentences.chinese: 照應詞的指稱對象是一個心理存在。

sentences.english: Indirect anaphora is a relatively new field in recent linguistic research.
sentences.chinese: 間接照應是語言學中一項較新的研究領域。

sentences.english: The second part refers to comparison about the the anaphora and cataphora of Russian and cataphora of Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分是俄語後向照應與漢語下指的對比。

sentences.english: On the basis of the approaches mentioned in this paper, the author discusses how relevance theory is used to analyze bridging reference.
sentences.chinese: 本文介紹了語用照應的推想方法和語用照應因果論。

definition: to pry into or spy on/to snoop/to peep/to poke one's nose into/to peer/to get a glimpse of
to be in contact (with sb)/to associate/to interact/to get along (well, poorly)
to echo one another/to respond (in agreement)
to take care/to keep an eye on/to look after/to tell/to remind
